Outro.html: You will be created a new account.... summary page

OpenId Connect Client.description: Models an OpenId Connect or OAuth2 client

value.x-description: Specifies allowed URIs to redirect to after logout

items.x-help-text: Specifies allowed URIs to return tokens or authorization codes to

value.x-description: Specifies claims that is included in the access token for the client

items.x-help-text: Specifies claims that is included in the access token for the client

value.x-description: The URIs we will accept as destinations when returning authentication responses (tokens) after successfully authenticating users. Also referred to as reply URLs.

items.x-help-text: Specifies allowed URIs to return tokens or authorization codes to

value.x-description: Specifies the allowed CORS origins for JavaScript clients

items.x-help-text: Specifies the allowed CORS origins for JavaScript clients

Client Uri.description: URI to further information about the client (used on consent screen)

Logo Uri.description: URI to client logo (used on consent screen)

Require Consent.description: Specifies whether a consent screen is required

Allow Remember Consent.description: Specifies whether user can choose to store consent decisions

Enable Local Login.description: Specifies if local login is enabled for this client

Allowed Grant Types.description: Specifies the allowed grant types (legal combinations of AuthorizationCode, Implicit, Hybrid, ResourceOWner, ClientCredentials)

Identity Provider Restrictions.description: Specifies which external IdPs can be used with this client

Pair Wise Subject Salt.description: Specifies a salt value used in pair-wise subjectId generation for users of this client

Require PKCE.description: Specifies whether a proof key is required for authorization code based token requests

Allow Plain Text PKCE.description: Specifies whether a proof key can be sent using plain method (not recommended)

Require Request Object.description: Specifies whether the client must use a request object on authorization requests

Allow Access Tokens Via Browser.description: Controls whether accesss tokens are transmitted via the browser for this client. This can prevent accidential leakage of access tokens when multiple resposne types are allowed.

Status.description: Specifies if the client is enabled

Require Client Secret.description: If set to false, no client secret is needed to request tokens at the token endpoint

Redirect Uris.description: Specifies allowed URIs to return tokens or authorization codes to

Post Logout Redirect URIs.description: Specifies allowed URIs to redirect to after logout

Front Channel Logout URI.description: Specifies logout URI at client for HTTP front-channel based logout

Include JWT Id.description: Specifies if JWT access token should include an identifier

Claims.description: Specifies claims that is included in the access token for the client

Always Send Client Claims.description: Specifies if Client Claims always should be included in accesss token, or only for client credentials flow

Client CLaims Prefix.description: Specifies a value to prefix client claim types

User SSO Lifetime.description: The maximum duration (in seconds) since the last time the user authenticated (defaults no expiration)

User Code Type.description: Specifies the type of device flow user code

Allowed CORS Origins.description: Specifies the allowed CORS origins for JavaScript clients

Front Channel Logout Session Required.description: Specifies if the users sessions id should be sent to FrontChannelLogoutUri

Back Channel Logout URI.description: Specifies logout URI at client for HTTP back-channel based logout.

Back Channel Logout Session Required.description: Specifies if the users sessions id should be sent to BackChannelLogoutUri

Allowed Scopes.description: Specifies the API scopes that the client is allowed to request, if empty, the client cant access any scopes

Always Include User Claims In Id Token.description: When requesting both an id token and access token, should the user claims always be added to the id token instead of requiring the client to use the userinfo endpoint

Identity Token Lifetime.description: Lifetime of the identity token in seconds

Access Token Lifetime.description: Lifetime of access token in seconds

Authorization Code Lifetime.description: Lifetime of authorization code in secords

Absolute Refresh Token Lifetime.description: Maximum lifetime of a refresh token in secords

Sliding Refresh Token Lifetime.description: Sliding lifetime of a refresh token in secords

Consent Lifetime.description: Lifetime of a user consent in seconds (defaults no expiration)

Refresh Token Usage.description: Specify if the refresh handle will be updated when refreshing tokens

Update Access Token Claims On Refresh.description: Specifies if access token and claims should be updated on a refresh token request

Refresh Token Expiration.description: Specifies if using absolute expiration or sliding expiration

Access Token Type.description: Specifies wheter the access token is a reference token or a self contained JWT token

Properties.description: Specifies custom properties for the client

OpenId Connect Resource.description: Models API, Identity and Scope Resources of OAuth2 Spec

Name.description: The unique name of the resource

Show In Discovery Document.description: Specifies whether this scope is shown in the discovery document

Properties.description: Specifies custom properties for the client

User Claims.description: List of associated user claims that should be included when this resource is requested

OpenId Connect API Resource.description: Models an OpenId Connect or OAuth2 Resource Scope

Required.description: Specifies whether the user can de-select the scope on the consent screen

Emphasize.description: Specifies whether the consent screen will emphasize this scope. Used for sensitive or important scopes

Require Resource Indicator.description: Indicates if this API resource requires the resource indicator to resquest it, and expects access tokens issues to it will only ever contain this API resource as the audience.

OpenId Connect Secret.description: Models a client secret with identifier and expiration

Api.description: The API Resource that this secret belongs to

Client.description: The OAuth Client that this secret belongs to

OpenId Connect Authorization.description: Models an OpenId Connect or OAuth2 Authorization

Properties.description: Specifies custom properties for the client

OpenId Connect Token.description: Models an OpenId Connect or OAuth2 Token

Properties.description: Specifies custom properties for the client

OpenId Connect Identity Resource.description: Models an OpenId Connect or OAuth2 Resource Scope

Profile.Name: profile
Profile.Description: Your user profile infomation (first name, last name, etc.)

Required.description: Specifies whether the user can de-select the scope on the consent screen

Emphasize.description: Specifies whether the consent screen will emphasize this scope. Used for sensitive or important scopes

OpenId Connect Scope.description: Models an OpenId Connect or OAuth2 Resource Scope

Required.description: Specifies whether the user can de-select the scope on the consent screen

Emphasize.description: Specifies whether the consent screen will emphasize this scope. Used for sensitive or important scopes

Filled From IP.description: A field for storing the IP that the data was filled from, either ipv4 or IPv6

Public Tournaments.filter: PublishNotBefore ne null and PublishNotBefore le now()

Status.description: The status of the contact - inactive contacts are not used, nor showed in lists

Primary Email.description: The primary email used for communicating with the contact

Account Role.description: The roles a person can have with the account. (Billing, Primary, Aministrator)

Is Public.description: Controls if external users may use / assign this role

Contact Information.description: The way of contacting a contact or account

Domain.description: The homepage domain name / host where the customer can have quotation forms embeded

Security Role Permission.description: The Many to Many relationship between security roles and permissions
